Name: Are your book fairs in-person?
Answer: Yes! We are thrilled to offer a full-service, in-person book fair experience that will captivate the hearts and minds of children, parents, and teachers alike.

Name: But you will have Catholic books, right?
Answer:
Yes! For our Catholic schools, we include a carefully curated selection of Catholic books—stories about the saints, Bible stories, and books that explain the faith in an engaging and age-appropriate way. Many of these titles are co-published by Magnificat and Ignatius Press, including beloved books by Tomie dePaola. We also feature titles from respected Catholic publishers including the Augustine Institute and Bethlehem Books among many others.

For schools that request a nonreligious selection—such as public charter schools—we tailor the collection accordingly. No matter the school setting, all books are chosen to be wholesome, enriching, and aligned with the needs of the communities we serve.

Name: Can I see the list of books that is sent to the Ignatius Book Fairs?
Answer:
Our full book fair list is proprietary, but we’re happy to share a customized preview with schools and organizations after learning more about your goals and needs. In the meantime, you're welcome to browse our online store to get a sense of our high-quality, mission-aligned titles.

Our fairs feature a curated selection of both faith-based and wholesome, secular books, carefully chosen to align with the values of the communities we serve.

‍

Name: Can we shop for additional books from your website at an in-person book fair?
Answer: Yes, our website offers an extensive collection of hundreds of more books, with new additions being made regularly.  All these books are conveniently available with free shipping to your school during our book fairs. And your school earns Ave dollars for all online purchases.

Name: Can we shop for additional books from your website at an in-person book fair?
Answer: Yes, our website offers an extensive collection of hundreds of more books, with new additions being made regularly.  All these books are conveniently available with free shipping to your school during our book fairs. And your school earns Ave dollars for all online purchases.

Name: Do the Ignatius Book Fairs offer any rewards for schools?
Answer: The Ignatius Book Fairs offer 20% in Ave Dollars or 10% cash back on the total of your sales (excluding tax). For book fairs that sell $6,000 or more, we will increase this offer to 40% in Ave Dollars or 20% cash back.

Name: Do you have a mascot?
Answer: We are thrilled to unveil our new mascot, Loupio, the beloved protagonist of the widely acclaimed comic book series The Adventures of Loupio! Keep an eye out for Loupio as he makes his appearance on our website, social media platforms, and during our exciting book fairs.

Name: Do you have a mascot?
Answer: Yes! Our official mascot is Loupio, the beloved protagonist of the widely acclaimed comic book series The Adventures of Loupio. You’ll see him featured throughout our website, on social media, and even making appearances during our book fairs—bringing joy, energy, and a love of reading to students and families.

Name: Do you have a minimum book fair sales requirement?
Answer: We do not have a set minimum for book fair sales, as we carefully select schools and parishes that are the perfect fit for an engaging in-person book fair.

Name: Do you have a minimum book fair sales requirement?
Answer: We do not have a set minimum for book fair sales, as we carefully select schools that are the perfect fit for an engaging in-person book fair.

Name: Do you have my dates available?
Answer:
The best way to secure your ideal book fair dates is to reach out as soon as possible. We cannot hold dates until you receive a contract, so booking early and signing the contract within three business days of receiving it is the best way to secure your dates.

Name: Do you offer seasonal titles?
Answer: Yes, fall book fairs include titles for Advent and Christmas, while spring fairs feature books for Easter, First Holy Communion, and Confirmation.

Name: Do you offer seasonal titles?
Answer: We offer age-appropriate seasonal books —perfect for the holiday seasons.

Name: Do you send only Christian books?
Answer:
No, about 70% of the books we send are wholesome, nonreligious books, such as fiction, inspiring biographies, fairytales, and classic children’s books. We also include books about sports, history, arts and crafts, and more. All these books have been fully vetted to ensure that the content is safe for children and will nourish their imaginations. We believe that children deserve to read great books!

For our public charter schools, we curate a fully nonreligious collection while maintaining the same standard of high-quality, meaningful literature.  Our goal is to offer students great books that spark curiosity, inspire imagination, and support strong character.

‍

Name: Find a Book Fair Near You!
Answer: Want to host or attend an Ignatius Book Fair? Visit ignatiusbookfairs.com to fill out an inquiry form today!

Name: How are book fair materials shipped and returned?
Answer: All book fair materials are shipped directly to your location from our state-of-the-art warehouse in Illinois. Once your fair is complete, simply repack any remaining merchandise using the same boxes and packing materials they arrived in. Keep the posters, tablecloths, flyers and bookmarks. Let us know how many boxes you're returning, and we'll schedule a pickup for you. It's a smooth, hassle-free process—so you can focus on celebrating a successful fair!

Name: How do we handle processing payments?
Answer: Customers can conveniently pay using their preferred method—card, cash, or check. To ensure a seamless experience, we’ll provide you with high-quality point-of-sale devices along with comprehensive training to help you use them with ease.

Answer: Customers can conveniently pay using their preferred method—card, cash, or check. To ensure a seamless experience, we’ll provide you with high-quality point-of-sale devices along with comprehensive training to help you use them with ease.

Name: How do you redeem your Ave Dollars balance?
Answer: Any Ave Dollars balance can be redeemed on the website.

Name: How does the e-Wallet work?
Answer: When this feature is available, all you have to do is find your school’s book fair to sign up and add funds. Then just share the link with friends and family, who can do the same. The remaining balance after the fair will become a gift card to shop online with Ignatius Book Fairs.

Name: How long should my fair run?
Answer: Based on the size and setup of your school or parish, we suggest a duration of five to seven days for your book fair. Our experienced Book Fair Pros will assist you in determining the optimal length of time for your event.

Name: How long should my fair run?
Answer: Based on the size and setup of your school, we suggest a duration of five to seven days for your book fair. Our experienced Book Fair Pros will assist you in determining the optimal length of time for your event.

Name: How many books do you send to a book fair?
Answer: The number of titles your fair receives will be based on a number of factors such as school size, previous sales, and your preferences. Our book fair pros will help you with this. All organizations will  be given the opportunity to make adjustments during our customization process, which happens approximately 60-90 days before your fair begins.

Name: How many books do you send to a book fair?
Answer: The number of titles your fair receives will be based on a number of factors such as school size, previous sales, and your preferences. Our book fair pros will help you with this. All organizations will  be given the opportunity to make adjustments during our customization process, which happens approximately 60-90 days before your fair begins.

Name: How much does a virtual book fair cost?
Answer:
We offer different options to suit your needs. If you have never hosted a book fair with Ignatius, we have 2 different boxes of books that you can order during the sign-up process so that you have a wonderful selection of our best sellers in order to use as display items and for advertising.  The cost of the box you choose is $175 and the books you receive are valued at $300. Payment must be received within 15 days of signing the contract. For those who have hosted a fair with Ignatius Book Fairs before, we also offer an option without a starter box of books.

‍

Name: How much does a virtual book fair cost?
Answer:
We offer different options to suit your needs. If you have never hosted a book fair with Ignatius, we have 2 different boxes of books that you can order during the sign-up process so that you have a wonderful selection of our best sellers in order to use as display items and for advertising. You can choose either Catholic/religious book selections, or a mix of secular and religious books. The cost of the box you choose is $175 and the books you receive are valued at $300. Payment must be received within 15 days of signing the contract. For those who have hosted a fair with Ignatius Book Fairs before, we also offer an option without a starter box of books.

‍

Name: Is there a cost to hosting a book fair?
Answer:
Hosting an Ignatius Book Fair comes at no cost to you outside of time and talent. We will provide you with a comprehensive package including all the books, payment devices, eye-catching advertising aids, beautifully designed marketing materials, sturdy book stands, and just about everything you will need to ensure the success of your book fair.

VIRTUAL FAIRS
We have various options for those interested in hosting a virtual fair. Your book fair professional will go over options. Some may have a small cost if you would like a box of starter books to display during the fair. These books will be yours to keep.

‍

Name: What ages does the book fair cater to?
Answer: The Ignatius Book Fair provides books for children in grades K-8, including picture books, comic books, early readers, elementary and middle school books. We do include one table of books for "Older Teens 16+ and Adults" so the whole family can pick up a book at our fairs!

Name: What are Ave Dollars?
Answer: This is virtual money that can be spent at the end of your book fair in-person, over the payment device, or on our website so that you can buy more books for your libraries, classrooms, or other groups, clubs and organizational needs.

Name: What are Ave Dollars?

Name: What happens if we have an unexpected problem during a book fair?
Answer: Your Book Fair Manager will be available should any problems arise during a book fair. We are here to help!

Name: What happens if we have an unexpected problem during a book fair?
Answer: Your Book Fair Manager will be available should any problems arise during a book fair. We are here to help!

Name: What if I need to cancel, extend, delay, or change the dates of my book fair?
Answer: If you need to cancel, extend, delay, or change book fair dates, please contact your Book Fair Pro as soon as possible. In unexpected cases, the school may be responsible for reimbursing shipping and/or marketing expenses.

Name: What if I need to cancel, extend, delay, or change the dates of my book fair?
Answer: If you need to cancel, extend, delay, or change book fair dates, please contact your Book Fair Pro as soon as possible. In unexpected cases, the school may be responsible for reimbursing shipping and/or marketing expenses.

Name: What if my school  is too small for an in-person book fair?
Answer:
Ignatius Book Fairs offers a virtual book fair. These are ideal for smaller schools. This event requires much less volunteer time and effort to organize. This option is available to larger schools too if they don’t want to host a full onsite book fair.

Is there a minimum sales requirement?

We ask that you feel confident that you have enough community support to generate at least $1000 in sales, although there is no minimum requirement.

How much does a Virtual Book Fair cost?

The cost is $175, which includes all the books, supplies, and customer support you need for a successful event. Payment must be received within 15 days of signing the contract.

What do you send us?

One week before your virtual fair begins, each organization will be sent an official virtual book fair kit. The kit will include 50 book fair flyers, 50 bookmarks, and the selection of our most popular, best-selling books you opted to receive. You may keep these books OR re-sell them at list price after your virtual book fair concludes.

How are books purchased?

All the shopping is done entirely on our website, store.ignatiusbookfairs.com and payment is by credit card. Customers simply create an online account, select your school, and start shopping!

NOTE: After your online book fair ends, if you choose to re-sell the sample books, your organization is responsible for accepting payment via check, cash, FACTS, etc.

Do you offer rewards for our organization?

Yes! Your organization will earn “Ave Dollars” which can be redeemed on our website to buy books. We offer 30% of all online sales (excluding tax) in Ave Dollars if your sales exceed $3,000. Here's an example of what you can earn:

30% Ave Dollars 

$1000 earns $300 Ave Dollars

$2000 earns $600 Ave Dollars 

$3000 earns $900 Ave Dollars 

Over $3000 earns $900 + $75 in Surprise Bonus Books  

How long will our online book fair last?

The online book fair will last 7 days. Remember, you will need a plan to promote shopping before, during, and after the event. Books ordered during the event will have the option to be held and sent to your organization with FREE shipping. Your organization is responsible for distributing these books.

What work is required from our organization?

Your main role will be to advertise your event using all the communications your organization sends out: newsletters, social media posts, in the official calendar, etc. It’s best practice to advertise often leading up to the fair, then each day during the fair. To make this easy, we provide a comprehensive set of advertising resources. If your community doesn’t know about the fair, or forgets that it is happening, they won’t order! Advertising ideas will be talked about during our live workshop for virtual fairs. Please plan to sign up to attend when you receive the invitation. You will be sent the recording even if you were not able to make it to the session.

How do we advertise?

We will send you a digital kit with social media graphics, a wish list, a digital catalog and instructions on how to use them. We will also be talking a lot about advertising during our live workshop, which is built especially for our virtual fair coordinators.

What do we do after the online book fair ends?

We will notify you about your total online sales and add the Ave Dollars to your account, so you can start using the rewards you have earned!

How do we schedule a “Virtual Book Fair”?

Contact a Book Fair Pro

‍

‍

Name: What if we’ve never hosted a book fair before?
Answer:
First book fair? No problem! Our experienced staff will help you along the way. After signing a contract, we will send you a document called “Your Guide to Hosting a Successful Ignatius Book Fair,” which will explain in detail all our tips, tricks, and suggestions to help you plan a fantastic event. We will also break this document down into bite-sized nuggets that will arrive via email at strategic intervals to give you time to implement these tips before moving on. Plan to join us for a 3-part workshop series to help guarantee your success, particularly for first-timers. This is a live, interactive series with a short presentation, and time for questions and answers. We will cover all aspects of how to plan, host and close a successful fair.

‍

Answer: Our Ignatius Book Fairs team is truly exceptional! Guided by seasoned experts from Ave Maria University and Ignatius Press, our Operations Team comprises individuals with vast experience in both Catholic schools and book fairs. Additionally, we have enthusiastic student interns from Ave Maria University lending their support. We cannot wait to connect with you!

Name: Why did Ave Maria University and Ignatius Press start book fairs?
Answer:
Ave Maria University and Ignatius Press have launched book fairs to offer a refreshing, high-quality alternative to other nationally known book fairs. Our goal is to provide children with access to literature that can shape their minds and enrich their lives in meaningful and lasting ways.
